body:
Is it possible for you to not anonymise your examples ?

On Mon, Mar 14, 2016 at 4:13 PM, Viet Hung Nguyen <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> git.example.com/repo/t-p/tw/kickkick $ go test -cover -v .
> # git.example.com/repo/t-p/tw/kickkick_test
> ./kickass_test.go:7: can't find import: "git.example.com/repo/t-p"
> FAIL    git.example.com/repo/t-p/tw/kickkick [build failed]
>
> it's when I run -cover test for a subpackage of a subpackage of a package.
> The test file imports:
>
> package kickkick_test
>
> import (
>     "net/http"
>     "testing"
>
>     "git.example.com/repo/t-p"
>     tw "git.example.com/repo/t-p/tw"
> )
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/14811#issuecomment-196145419>.
>
